gurmukhi: sB myG gey Gt ky jb hI qb hI hrKy Pun gop sBY ] ieh BwNq lgy khny muK qy Bgvwn dXo hm dwn ABY ]
transliteration: Sabh Megh Gad Ghat Ke Jab Hitab Hiharkhe Phoun Gop Sabhai|| Eh Bhaant Lage Kahne Moukh Te Bhagvaan Dayo Ham Daan Abhai||
translation: When the clouds dwindled away, then all the gopas were pleased and said, “The Lord (Krishna) has given us fearlessness;

gurmukhi: mGvw ju krI kup daur hsU pr so iqh ko nhI byr lBY ] Ab kwnH pRqwp qy hY Gt bwdr eyk n dIsq bIc nBY ]374]
transliteration: Maghvaa Ju Karikoup Daur Hamoondpar So Tih Ko Nahiber Labhai|| Ab Kaahn Prataap Te Hai Ghat Baadar Ek Na Deesat Beech Nabhai||374||
translation: Indra had attacked us in his fury, but he is invisible no;w and through the glory of Krishna, there is not even one cloud in the sky.374.

gurmukhi: gop khY sBhI muK qy ieh kwnH blI br hY bl mY ] ijn kUd iklY sq mor mrXo ijn ju`D sMKwsur so jl mY ]
transliteration: Gop Kahai Sabh-himoukh Te Eh Kaahn Balibar Hai Bal Mai|| Jin Kood Kilai Sat Mor Daryo Jin Juddh Sankhaasur So Jal Mai||
translation: All the gopas said, “Krishna is extremely powerful; he, who killed Mur by jumping in the fort and Shankhasura in water;

gurmukhi: ieh hY krqw sB hI jg ko Aru PYl rhXo jl Aau QlI mY ] soaU Awie pRq`iC BXo biRj mY joaU jog juqo rhY EJl mY ]375]
transliteration: Eh Hai Hartaa Sabh Hijag Ko Ar(u) Phail Rahyo Jal Au Thalimai|| Sooo Aae Pratachchh(i) Bhayo Brij Mai Jooo Jog Jouto Rahai Mai||375||
translation: He is the Creator of the whole world and pervades on the plains and in waters, He, who was felt imperceptible earlier, He has come now in Braja apparently.375.

gurmukhi: mor mrXo ijn kUd iklY sq isMD jrw ijh sYn mrI ] nrkwsur jwih krXo rksI ibrQI gj kI ijh r`C krI ]
transliteration: Mor Daryo Jin Kood Kilai Sat Sindh Jaraa Jih Sain Daree|| Narkaasur Jaah(i) Daryo Raksibirthigad Kijih Racchchh Daree||
translation: He, who killed the demon Mur, by jumping in the fort, and who destroyed the army of Jarasandh, who destroyed Narakasura and who protected the elephant from octopus;

gurmukhi: ijh rwK leI piq pY dRupqI isl jw lg iqau pg pwg prI ] Aiq kopq myGn Aau mGvw ieh rwK leI nMd lwl DrI ]376]
transliteration: Jih Raakh Laipat(i) Pai Droupatisil Jaa Lag Tio Pag Paag Pariat(i) Kopat Meghan Au Maghvaa Eh Raakh Lainand Laal Ddaree||376||
translation: He, who protected the honour of Daropati and with whose touch, Ahalya, who had been transformed into a stone, was saved, the same Krishna protected us from extremely enraged clouds and Indra.376.

gurmukhi: mGvw ijh Pyir deI pRqnw ijh dYq mrY ieh kwnH blI ] ijhko jn nwm jpY mn mY ijhko Pun BRwq hY bIr hlI ]
transliteration: Maghvaa Jih Pher(i) Daipratnaa Jih Dait Darai Eh Kaahn Balee|| Jihko Jan Naam Japai Man Mai Jihko Phoun Bhraat Hai Beer Halee||
translation: He, who caused Indra to run away, who killed Putana and other demons, he is Krishna; He also is Krishna, whose name is remembered by all in the mind and whose brother is the brave Haldhar;

gurmukhi: ijhqy sB gopn kI ibpqw hir ky kup qy iCn mwih tlI ] iqh ko lKkY aupmw Bgvwn krY ijhkI suq kaul klI ]377]
transliteration: Jihte Sabh Gopan Kibiptaa Har(i) Ke Koup Te Chhin Mah(i) Talee|| Tih Ko Lakh0kai Oupmaa Bhagvaan Darai Jihkisout Kaul Kalee||377||
translation: Because of the Krishna, the trouble of gopas was finished in an instant and this is the praise of the same Lord, who transforms ordinary buds into bit lotus-flowers and raises very high an ordinary man.377.

gurmukhi: kwnH aupwr lXo grUE igr Dwm iKswie gXo mGvw ] so aupjXo biRj BUm ibKY joaU qIsr ju`g BXo rGuvw ]
transliteration: Kaahn Oupaar Layo Darooo Gir Dhaan Khisaae Gado Maghvaa|| So Oupjyo Brij Bhoom Bikhai Jooo Teesar Jougg Bhayo Raghuvaa||
translation: On this side, Krishna carried the Goverdhan mountain, on the other side Indra, feeling ashamed in his mind, said that He, who was Ram in Treta age, has now incarnated in Braja;

gurmukhi: Ab kauqik lok idKwvn ko jg mY Pun rUp DrXo lGvw ] Qn AYNc hnI iCn mY puqnw hirnwm ky lyqhry AGvw ]378]
transliteration: Ab Kaoutak(i) Lok Dikhaavan Ko Jag Mai Phoun Roop Ddaryo Laghavaa|| Than Ainch Hanichhin Mai Poutanaa Harinaam Ke Let-dare Aghvaa||378||
translation: And in order to show to the world his amorous play, he has assumed the short-statured form of man; he killed Putana in an instant by pulling her teat and also destroyed the demon Aghasura in an instant.378.
